subject: AI & Agents
title: How Inference Works: Token by Token
description: A short lesson to help you apply How Inference Works: Token by Token.

hook.text: You hit send and tokens appear one by one. Each one required a full model forward pass.

buildup.text: Autoregressive inference generates one token, appends it, then runs the model again.

discovery.text: KV caching stores previous attention computations so you don't recompute them.

twist.text: The first token is slowest (processes full prompt). Subsequent tokens are cheaper.

punchline.text: Each token waits for the last one.

quiz.question: Why is the first token the slowest during inference?
options: It must process the entire prompt
